programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Roundtables
programme.desc: A Black lacrosse experience through the eyes of pros. JT Giles-Harris, Mark McNeill, Nat St. Laurent, Kyle Harrison, Myles Jones and Koby Smith sit down for an open and honest conversation about being Black in the sport of lacrosse. Honored that these pros allowed us to sit in on this conversation for Black History Month.

Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Week 1: "Commentators III" features Howard Lederer, Gabe Kaplan, Joe Sebok, Ali Nejad, Mark Gregorich, and Kara Scott.

programme.title: Super High Roller Cash Game | $500/$1,000 No-Limit Hold'em
programme.desc: Super High Roller Cash Game returns with a $500/$1,000 No-Limit Hold'em cash game and a $250,000 minimum buy-in. Andrew Robl and Antonio Esfandiari are the headliners, and they'll be joined by Monkey Tilt Founder Sam Kiki, Kirk Brown, Big Al, Sammy, and Darin Feinstein.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Week 1: "Cash Game #1" features Tom Dwan, Phil Hellmuth, Mike Baxter, Allen Cunningham, Guy Laliberte, and David Peat playing $200/$400 No-Limit Hold'em.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #1: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Jeremy Ausmus is the chip leader ahead of Erik Seidel, Jacky Wang, Nick Schulman, Cole Ferraro, Anthony Hu, and Cary Katz, as the final seven players play for the $204,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.desc: Tim Allen grunts, he burps, he soups up his lawnmower and he's damn proud of it! Filled with family bits as well as the stuff we've come to love him for: tools, engine and cars. In this 1991 special, we see the Tim Allen we grew to love.

programme.title: Tim Allen: Men Are Pigs
programme.desc: In this special from 1990, Tim Allen proves men are pigs as he discusses family and the differences between women and men. In "Men are Pigs" , you see the groundwork for his successful show, "Home Improvement".

programme.title: The Sklar Brothers: What Are We Talking About
programme.desc: The Sklar Brothers' bring their A-game to Madison WI with their energetic new comedy special, What Are We Talking About. Watch the former zygote sharing duo duke it out over sports, mullets, and airportæetiquette,æinvoking their power house humor worthy of the hall of fame.

programme.title: Steve-O: Guilty as Charged

programme.title: Rita Rudner: A Tale of Two Dresses
programme.desc: The famed Vegas headliner returns, as witty, insightful,and cutting as ever, as she riffs on life as a sixty-something in today's America.

programme.desc: A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G preforms an autopsy on an alleged hit-and-run victim but finds no evidence of vehicular injury on the 41-year-old man's body. Could his alcoholism have had a role in his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two gang members threaten to kill Dr. Carroll while he tries to save three men with gunshot wounds.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Seven-year-old Brian has been hit by a truck and his arm has been ripped off.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors perform a chest incision while awaiting surgeons. An iguana is brought in following a car accident.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A soldier comes into the ER with a stab wound. A woman overdoses on diet pills.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman comes into the ER with severe abdominal pain and claims there is an alien in her stomach.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors must decide whether to put a hole in a teenager's head or wait for more help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A boy suffers from a massive brain hemorrhage after being hit by a baseball bat.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A 21-year-old man has suffered internal injuries in a motorcycle accident.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A skier clings to life after slamming into a tree at 50mph.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman complaining of abdominal pain finds out that she is in fact pregnant.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Follow the case of a boy with an oxygen deficiency and bizarre brown blood.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl is rushed to the ER with intermittent seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman complains of stomach pains after eating toilet paper. An inmate has a 108-degree fever.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: It's a busy day in the ER as Dr. Heilbron battles to treat a man whose intestine has come out, among others.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man goes into anaphylactic shock, a tough guy fears needles and a man stabs himself with a ninja sword.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman comes into the ER with severe abdominal pain and claims there is an alien in her stomach.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Jarret is rushed into ER after being violently tackled in a football game.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A bride on the way to her wedding suffers facial injuries after a car accident.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is rushed to the ER with a 16-inch bar protruding from his neck.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A policeman is struck by a speeding driver seeking revenge, which may leave him with no legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young girl comes into the ER and can't move from the waist down.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A boy suffers from a massive brain hemorrhage after being hit by a baseball bat.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient who comes in after his hand has been chopped off by a lawnmower.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors must look after their own when a psychotic gunman enters the hospital and starts shooting staff.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman is attacked by a mountain lion. A difficult lady has abdominal problems.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young boy at a sleepover party mysteriously loses control of his arms and legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor with a severe bee allergy is stung while treating a critical patient who's been stabbed in the eye; a man comes into the ER after slitting his own throat; a paramedic becomes a patient when she's struck by a mysterious illness.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man's head is impaled by a trophy deer's antlers, a nurse's ex brings his new girlfriend to the ER and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's face-lift goes wrong, a hospital chaplain's sudden personality change baffles the ER staff and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A wrist fracture turns into a medical mystery. Two fishermen get stuck on the same lure.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teenage girl is impaled through the neck on an iron fence; a patient is convinced he's turning into a vampire; a first-year attending physician stands up to a room full of senior specialists to save the life of a critically ill pregnant woman.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three patients sneak their pets into the hospital, causing pandemonium in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen football player suffers a stroke; a doctor remembers his first major trauma in the 1970s; a doctor tries to figure out what causes a patient's abdominal pain.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Presenting from York Gate in Leeds, Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill celebrate a garden for all seasons and tackle a bunch of seasonal jobs for September.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A catch-up with three sisters in Dorset to discover how their collapsed greenhouse turned into an opportunity to transform part of their garden. Plus, Monty plants garlic and onions, transplants foxgloves, and prepares his strawberry bed for winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, and Monty shares tips on what to do with windfalls before planting a container to give a colourful boost for winter insects. Plus, Adam Frost visits a designer who has overcome extreme weather and difficult terrain.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her new garden and assessing the tomatoes in her upcycled greenhouse, while Rekha Mistry shares the successes and failures of her new vegetable garden. Plus, Errol Reuben Fernandes heads to a contemporary garden in Wakefield.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Follow Bob Ross into a lovely mountain setting with magnificent evergreens, where the first touches of snow appear in the valley.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Discover a beautiful quiet lake hidden deep in the wilderness - and just beyond a glorious snow-covered mountain! - from the magical brushes of Bob Ross.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Stroll along a wonderful hustling, bubbling river with Bob Ross and enjoy the emergence of springtime blossoms on spectacular trees.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel to the coldest place imaginable with Bob Ross and find a lonely cabin comfortably nestled on the edge of a glassy-smooth frozen pond.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: An incredibly unique Bob Ross painting -- delight in the effects of white and black gesso, discover a birch tree forest perfectly mirrored in the cold stillness of winter.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a stormy lighthouse scene.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a rustic mill.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: In this one-of-a-kind masterpiece, Bob Ross paints a vibrant golden red glow, complete with cowboy restin' a while by the cracklin' flames.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A beautiful fall scene -- Bob Ross uses the colors of nature to settle an old worn-down farm building into soft golden grassy bushes and trees.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Talented guest artist Steve Ross creates clear blue skies, an almighty mountain and lake lined generously with trees and bushes.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross will fascinate you with this crimson winter scene, where cabin and snow are virtually undisturbed and the evergreens are full.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a pretty, hushed valley.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike is back after em in Alabama and finally finds a tone that this ol gobbler seems to like. Some timely calling and waiting patiently for this longbeard and his hen to make their way to his setup pays off. Back to work Mike, we have calls to make! It's the WoodHaven Way!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Team200 shares their lunar strategies for killing big Whitetails following the moon!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Adam Hays hunts big bucks in Iowa and Illinois

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With our annual "turkey tour" canceled due to COVID, Jerry and Austin go "all in" on the PA turkey season. Joining them this week are PFC's Kirk Sherbine and his son, True Form's David "Bunch" Hale, and Sportsman Channel's Rob Freyer. Will they hit the "jackpot" of all turkey seasons? Or lose it all?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: As an avid bird hunter who grew up sharing his passion with his dad, Mark Peterson has traveled the globe pursuing his favorite game. After completing the North America Upland Slam and the New Zealand Wingshooting Slam both in a single season, he’s setting his sights on the South America Upland Slam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Shawn finally connects with a big Montana Public Land Mule Deer after many incredible stalks throughout the week. This week was one for the books filled with many ups and downs! We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 2 of this epic Montana Bow hunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. Jim Ross team up again to catch some Tarpon off the Space Coast right in front of the rockets. This was the biggest tarpon of the season for sure.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. John Beach are at it again, in Crystal River catching some great snook right off the mouth of the river.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads down to Islamorada with Capt. Jim Ross aboard the Tunnel Vision Sportfishing Freeman to catch swordfish in the middle of the day.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair stops in Steinhatchee for some Redfish and Trout with Leiza Fitzgerald from CCA Florida.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: We’re headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirty’s Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Drake Waterfowl's Jimbo Ronquest joins the crew in Louisana for the last day of the Realtree Max-7 pro-staff hunt. It is a morning to remember as the ducks fall into the decoys and the guys limit out before 8:00 a.m. on the Mississippi flyway.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike is back after em in Alabama and finally finds a tone that this ol gobbler seems to like. Some timely calling and waiting patiently for this longbeard and his hen to make their way to his setup pays off. Back to work Mike, we have calls to make! It's the WoodHaven Way!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Team200 shares their lunar strategies for killing big Whitetails following the moon!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Adam Hays hunts big bucks in Iowa and Illinois

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With our annual "turkey tour" canceled due to COVID, Jerry and Austin go "all in" on the PA turkey season. Joining them this week are PFC's Kirk Sherbine and his son, True Form's David "Bunch" Hale, and Sportsman Channel's Rob Freyer. Will they hit the "jackpot" of all turkey seasons? Or lose it all?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: As an avid bird hunter who grew up sharing his passion with his dad, Mark Peterson has traveled the globe pursuing his favorite game. After completing the North America Upland Slam and the New Zealand Wingshooting Slam both in a single season, he’s setting his sights on the South America Upland Slam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Shawn finally connects with a big Montana Public Land Mule Deer after many incredible stalks throughout the week. This week was one for the books filled with many ups and downs! We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 2 of this epic Montana Bow hunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. Jim Ross team up again to catch some Tarpon off the Space Coast right in front of the rockets. This was the biggest tarpon of the season for sure.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. John Beach are at it again, in Crystal River catching some great snook right off the mouth of the river.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads down to Islamorada with Capt. Jim Ross aboard the Tunnel Vision Sportfishing Freeman to catch swordfish in the middle of the day.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair stops in Steinhatchee for some Redfish and Trout with Leiza Fitzgerald from CCA Florida.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: We’re headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirty’s Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Drake Waterfowl's Jimbo Ronquest joins the crew in Louisana for the last day of the Realtree Max-7 pro-staff hunt. It is a morning to remember as the ducks fall into the decoys and the guys limit out before 8:00 a.m. on the Mississippi flyway.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team begin their day by judging the local elementary school's talent show, where they declare all the kids to be winners.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Bounty hunts are always full of surprises and that is very true today. Dog is in search of a potentially dangerous fugitive, he's only 19 and charged with kidnapping and menacing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has history of domestic abuse and assault, and now he's facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is busy. First he's after a fugitive who is allegedly an expert in the game of "burn and return"--shoplifting goods to return them for cash refunds. But he's not easy to track.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have their hands full when they go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the posse are off to the Big Island for their wedding. They hope to relax for a few days and take care of final details but it turns out Leland has a fugitive he needs to capture.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
